column1: Jatibonico is a municipality and town in the Sancti Sp√≠ritus Province of Cuba.

column2: the municipality of Jatibonico had a population of 42
column3: 959. With a total area of 765 km2 (295 sq mi)
column4: it has a population density of 55.8/km2 (145/sq mi).

column1: A gallery of stained glass windows can be found at Jatibonico's St. Joseph Catholic Parish Church
column2: unique in its kind in the whole of Cuba.

column1: The Jatibonico Oil Field was discovered in the early 1950s by Grupo Jarueca after surface oil seeps were noticed in the area.  Oil was discovered at a depth of about 1
column2: 100 feet in a marly shale within a structural high.  This was the first new field discovered in the post-World War II era and the start of several more fields in the Central Basin of Cuba.
